**Course objectives:**

This course aims to strengthen students’ expository writing abilities and composition skills. Class lessons are designed to guide students to write well-formed essays through the process of: prewriting, planning, drafting, editing and revising. In the year-long course, students will be introduced to and practice writing different kinds of essays that fall within four major categories of: narration, description, exposition and argumentation. Overall, course learning include: lectures, in-class discussions, essay assingments, peer critique and writing consultations with the instructor. 

Recommended Textbook 

Wyrick, Jean. _Steps to Writing Well (Twelfth Edition)_. Boston, MA: Wadsworth, Cengage Learning

**Course Requirements: :**

(1). Class participation, in-class exercises and homework assignments: 25%

(2). Essay Assignments: 55%

(3) Peer critique : 20%

methodologies.note: Students will be asked to share their ideas on readings. Then, using the ideas from the readings, students will brainstorm ideas for their essays.

grading.note: Students will have a final exam.
Students will have opportunities to discuss orally about the readings.
Students will share their writings orally.
Students will have an opportunity to share what they have written in a portfolio. The goal of the portfolio is to document how students grow as a writer.
